abstract: Information from whistle-blowers led to the company’s agreement to pay $762 million to settle investigations into the marketing of some top-selling drugs.
snippet: Information from whistle-blowers led to the company’s agreement to pay $762 million to settle investigations into the marketing of some top-selling drugs.
lead_paragraph: “I hope no one is taping this,” the Amgen manager remarked at a company sales meeting in 2005.

headline.main: Amgen Workers Helped U.S. in Marketing Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Amgen Workers Helped U.S. in Marketing Inquiry
